div.p: Rhodes School for the Performing Arts has always been a school district that encouraged and nurtured a community-based education system. We are CREW, not passenger. We take pride in our commitment to providing a safe, creative, innovative and rigorous learning environment for all our scholars. Unfortunately, due to COVID-19 we have all had to rearrange a lot in our lives to help our community and health professionals flatten the curve and exposure risk to COVID-19. RSPA leadership has been working tirelessly with all critical departments to ensure that our students are still being provided with the best. We have moved all instruction, both core curriculum and fine arts curriculum, online (if you are still in need of a Chromebook and would like to check one out, please email [email protected]). Our communications department is sending updates and notifications from the district in a timely manner (please email [email protected] if you are not receiving text alerts or parent emails). We know that time are uncertain, but we are a CREW and we will get through together. Please rest assured that we are doing all that we can to support our scholars and families during this time.
Thank you for all that you do-

div.div:
Rhodes School for the Performing Arts is a fine arts magnet school of distinction. We expand the educational choice of families with children Pre-K through 8th grade while providing increased opportunities for students. Founded on the principles of Scholarship, Leadership, and Citizenship, we now celebrate our tenth year in education.
Overall Grades offered NOW *PreK3-8th
PreK3 and PreK4 must meet eligibility requirements
Northshore: PreK3-7th
Channelview: PreK3-5th
Northwest: K-5
Humble: PreK3-8th
© 2017 Rhodes School for the Performing Arts. All Rights Reserved
